figure_1.title: Fig. 2. Countries of authors of Ultrasonography from 2014 to 2019.

figure_2.title: Fig. 3. The number of total cites of Ultrasonography based on the Crossref metadata, Scopus, and Web of Science Core Collection (WOS) by year.

figure_3.title: Fig. 4. Impact factor of Ultrasonography based on the Crossref metadata, Scopus, and Web of Science Core Collection (WOS) by year.

figure_4.title: Fig. 5. Top 10 countries from which authors cited Ultrasonography most frequently and their frequency based on the Web of Science Core Collection [cited 2020 Mar 16].

figure_5.title: Fig. 6. The journals most frequently citing Ultrasonography in publications from 2014 to 2019 and their frequency based on the Web of Science Core Collection [cited 2020 Mar 16].

figure_6.title: Fig. 7. The top 10 journal titles in references in Ultrasonography and their frequency from 2014 to 2019.

claims.sentence:
A comparison with other related journals was described for the impact factor.Results
Citable and Non-citable Articles
As shown in Fig. 1, the number of citable articles, including reviews, original articles, and case reports, was consistently 40 from 2014 to 2019.

Open in a new tab
Citable articles: reviews, original articles, and case reports; non-citable articles: letters and editorials.Countries of Authors Who Published in Ultrasonography

The number of countries of authors from 2014 to 2015 was 4; that from 2016 to 2017 was 12; and that from 2018 to 2019 was 22 (Fig. 2, Supplementary Data 1).

Open in a new tabTotal Cites
The number of total cites of Ultrasonography based on the Crossref metadata, Scopus, and Web of Science Core Collection are presented in Fig. 3 (Supplementary Data 2).

Open in a new tabTwo-Year Impact Factor
The 2-year impact factor and equivalent citation metrics are presented in Fig. 4.
The top-ranking countries are presented in Fig. 5.
The top 9 most frequently citing journals are presented in Fig. 6.
Of these citations, the most frequently listed journal titles are presented in Fig. 7.
The difference in total cites across the three databases originated from differences in the journals included in each database (Fig. 3).
The same issue arose in the estimation of the 2-year impact factor (Fig. 4).
Korea, the United States, and China have been found to be most common countries of citing authors in most medical journals in Korea (Fig. 5) [15].
The authors of Ultrasonography most frequently cited Radiology, American Journal of Roentgenology, Journal of Ultrasound Medicine, Ultrasound Medicine and Biology, and European Radiology (Fig. 7).
Ultrasonography most frequently received citations from Ultrasound in Medicine and Biology, Journal of Ultrasound in Medicine, Korean Journal of Radiology, and European Radiology (Fig. 6).

A comparison with other related journals was described for the impact factor.Results
